noun.description: A person who gives up or abandons something, as a place or belief.

adjective.description: Originally and chiefly US. Characterized by or relating to default or non-payment.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in John Goodwin (?1594–1665), Independent minister. From classical Latin relinquent-, relinquēns, present participle of relinquere relinquish.
